qas.question: What does the army use for facilities while they are deployed?
What are the barracks used for?
Where are the dining facilities called?
What is the abbreviation for a tactical operations center?
What does the Coast Guard use for facilities while they are deployed?
What are DFAC ships used for?

context: The army has relied heavily on <a0_0><b5_0>tents<b5_0/><a0_0/> to provide the various facilities needed while on deployment. The most common tent uses for the military are as temporary <b8_0>barracks<b8_0/> (<a1_0><b6_0>sleeping quarters<b6_0/><a1_0/>), <a2_0>DFAC buildings<a2_0/> (dining facilities), <a3_0><b7_0>forward operating bases<b7_0/><a3_0/> (FOBs), after action review (AAR), tactical operations center (<a4_0>TOC<a4_0/>), morale, welfare, and recreation (MWR) facilities, and security checkpoints. Furthermore, most of these tents are set up and operated through the support of <b9_0>Natick Soldier Systems Center<b9_0/>.
